title: Prohibition Era Bar Experience
short_description: It's chilly outside, time to warm up with spirits and libations. Join the hidden speakeasy bar tour in New York to discover the clandestine spots of the prohibition era.
long_description:
It's chilly outside, time to warm up with spirits and libations. Join the hidden speakeasy bar tour in New York to discover the clandestine spots of the prohibition era. Be transported to the 1920's, as you hop between four hard to find locations, led by a local guide. The appeal of the Roaring Twenties was secrecy and hush hush attitude people had to adopt in order consume alcohol.The Prohibition Era ended in 1933 but it's legacy still remains with the creation of the cocktail. The tour includes three drinks, lots of knowledge and even a snack. The dress code is casual but it's more fun to dress the part, so feel to get fancy when you go!

Prohibition Era Bar Experience, Tickets are $59.00, every Monday & Wednesday at 7pm in front of McSorely's Old Ale House, located at 15 E 7th St, between 2nd and 3rd Ave. Must be 21+, photo I.D. required.
